page.title: 01 LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area of our grid comprises a landscape of fields with gentle hills and small areas of woodland in the lea of Wenlock Edge. It is an area of pleasant green fields mostly put to arable farming and grassland. There are areas of pine trees with small coppices of natural deciduous trees. Private woodlands are used for tree cutting and shooting. Large fields have hedges dividing them and hedges are found all along the roadside. This is a rural landscape with only one fertiliser distributing concern. Houses are scattered with only three centres of housing at Harley, Kenley and Woodside cottages. There are two Garden Centres providing additional employment and completing the rural scene.
